entry.title: Slow Horses
entry.content: I finished reading Slow Horses by Mick Herron.

entry.title: Strangers in Their Own Land: Anger and Mourning on the American Right
entry.content: I finished reading Strangers in Their Own Land: Anger and Mourning on the American Right by Arlie Russell Hochschild.

entry.title: Changing Our Mind: Definitive 3rd Edition of the Landmark Call for Inclusion of Lgbtq Christians with Response to Critics
entry.content: I finished reading Changing Our Mind: Definitive 3rd Edition of the Landmark Call for Inclusion of Lgbtq Christians with Response to Critics by David P. Gushee.

entry.title: A Thicker Jesus
entry.content: I finished reading A Thicker Jesus by Glen H. Stassen.

entry.title: Destined for Joy: The Gospel of Universal Salvation
entry.content: I finished reading Destined for Joy: The Gospel of Universal Salvation by Alvin F. Kimel.

entry.title: A Prayer for the Crown-Shy
entry.content: I finished reading A Prayer for the Crown-Shy by Becky Chambers.

entry.title: Small Things Like These
entry.content: I finished reading Small Things Like These by Claire Keegan.

entry.title: Sea of Tranquility
entry.content: I finished reading Sea of Tranquility by Emily St. John Mandel.

entry.title: The Coffin Dancer
entry.content: I finished reading The Coffin Dancer by Jeffery Deaver.

entry.title: A Psalm for the Wild-Built
entry.content:
I finished reading A Psalm for the Wild-Built by Becky Chambers.

Simply lovely and delightful. It’s somehow as if Wendell Berry started writing sci-fi short stories. I will be coming back to this one for sure.

entry.title: The Life of Saint Teresa of Avila: A Biography
entry.content: I finished reading The Life of Saint Teresa of Avila: A Biography by Carlos Eire.

entry.title: The Blue Diamond (The Daughter of Sherlock Holmes Mysteries #6)
entry.content: I finished reading The Blue Diamond (The Daughter of Sherlock Holmes Mysteries #6) by Leonard Goldberg.

entry.title: History and Eschatology: Jesus and the Promise of Natural Theology
entry.content: I finished reading History and Eschatology: Jesus and the Promise of Natural Theology by N.T. Wright.

entry.title: Faith Victorious
entry.content:
I finished reading Faith Victorious by Lennart Pinomaa.

Perhaps it’s a fair summary of Luther’s teaching, but the author fawns over Luther to the point it feels disgusting.

entry.title: The Late Medieval English Church: Vitality and Vulnerability Before the Break with Rome
entry.content: I finished reading The Late Medieval English Church: Vitality and Vulnerability Before the Break with Rome by G.W. Bernard.

entry.title: Love over Fear: Facing Monsters, Befriending Enemies, and Healing Our Polarized World
entry.content: I finished reading Love over Fear: Facing Monsters, Befriending Enemies, and Healing Our Polarized World by Dan White Jr..

entry.title: The Dark Interval: Towards a Theology of Story
entry.content: I finished reading The Dark Interval: Towards a Theology of Story by John Dominic Crossan.

entry.title: The Phoenix Project: A Novel about It, Devops, and Helping Your Business Win
entry.content:
I finished reading The Phoenix Project: A Novel about It, Devops, and Helping Your Business Win by Gene Kim.

One step above the typical corporate training video; sort of a casual primer on lean thinking and DevOps. Michael Crichton would’ve made it a lot more interesting.

entry.title: Once a Thief
entry.content: I finished reading Once a Thief by Christopher Reich.

entry.title: The Invention of Religion: Faith and Covenant in the Book of Exodus
entry.content: I finished reading The Invention of Religion: Faith and Covenant in the Book of Exodus by Jan Assmann.
